column4: Definition
An aggregation of NYPL bibliographic resources, including any combination of Items, Components, or other Collections.
A grouping of one or more intellectual entities within a collection, such as an archival fonds, a record series.
An intellectual entity owned or managed by NYPL
Represents at least the physical dimensions of an nypl:Item. May coexist with other classes representing intellectual diensions.
Definition
(Corresponds to OPAC message in catalog) The message used to communicate how an item may be accessed at the library.
Any additional or alternative titles for the item.
Agency code for the item (NOT mapping for alpha)
Content cafe info about the author
Availability status of the item
Optical machine-readable representation of data relating to the item to which it is attached.
A shelf locator or call number of a resource.
Categorization reflecting the format of the storage medium and housing of a carrier.
The NYPL item type code from the Sierra record. Includes access restrictions for use in combination with other fields.
The NYPL center, division, branch, or unit responsible for custody of and access to the resource.
A person or organization who contributed to the creation of the item. (Includes meeting/conference names from LC authority file.)
column10:
Most authorized and local names are dereferenced (if necessary) and given an NYPL URI under the http://data.nypl.org/agents/ namespace.

For ease of mapping all core systems, no distinction is made between Creator and Contributor. All creators are included in Contributor property. Agents are also associated to Resoures through more granular role properties (MARC relators) if available in source system to better express this relationship.

column4: A person or organization who contributed to the creation of the item. (Includes meeting/conference names from LC authority file.)
column10: Most authorized and local names are dereferenced (if necessary) and given an NYPL URI under the http://data.nypl.org/agents/ namespace.

column4: Temporary alpha-version field for storing literal values from MARC 7xx until agent enrichment work meets quality control standards
Temporary alpha-version field for storing literal values from MARC 1xx and 7xx until agent enrichment work meets quality control standards
The cover image of the resource (Baker & Taylor Content Cafe, Open Library)
Temporary alpha-version field for storing literal values from MARC 1xx until agent enrichment work meets quality control standards
The date or period the item was originally created or published.
The date the item was originally created or published.
column11:
Tentative date properties, need to consider object as range (see DPLA use of edm:TimeSpan)

Look at encoding in EDTF

column4: The latest date recorded for the item. This could be the latest of multiple single dates or the end date of a date range.
The earliest date recorded for the item. This could be the earliest of multiple single dates or the start date of a date range.
Possible NYPL locations to which the physical item may be delivered.
A summary or description of the contents of the resource.
Measurements of the carrier or carriers and/or the container of a resource.
An online representation of the resource
Number and type of units and/or subunits making up a resource.
Content cafe text from the inner flap of the book
The location where the physical item is stored.
An identifier associated with the resource.
column10: See Identifier types tab for all identifiers used with Resource.

column4: A high-level work that the resource manifests.
column10: Currently using OCLC work identifiers (drawn from Classify on enrichment--classify:owi) to cluster related resources.

column4: Categorization reflecting whether a resource is issued in one or more parts, the way it is updated, and its intended termination.
column7: TBD (waiting for bf controlled list, or mint our own terms based on current bib-level values)

column4: The language(s) of the content of the resource
Placeholder property for the LCC classification of the resource
column10: Placeholder property and pattern for alpha release. Post-alpha we will consider bf classifiation property with Classification objects to accommodate multiple classifications

column4: Placeholder property for the LCC coarse classification of the resource
column10: Placeholder property and pattern for alpha release. Post-alpha we will consider bf classifiation property with Classification objects to accommodate multiple classifications

column4: Categorization reflecting the general type of intermediation device required to view, play, run, etc., the content of a resource.
A free text note associated with the resource.
column10: Notes prepended by normlalized label (see property mappings)
column11: TOC from Catalog are currently mapped to notes. We could potentially concatenate MARC 505s and map to dcterms:tableOfContents

column4: Convenience property to track the number of bf:Items associated with an nypl:Item
OCLC identifier
Placeholder property until we can entify place of publication
Publisher of the resource.
column10: Enrich through Agents pipeline (may need more attention for quality, since reconciling from uncontrolled string instead of authority).

column4: The publisher of the resource
Flag to tell if a user can place a hold on an item.
A broad resource type categorizing the content of the resource.
column7: Controlled subset of LC Resource Types Scheme: http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/resourceTypes.html
column10: Mostly consistent with BIBFRAME work subclasses, but represented as a property instead of a class type right now for simplicity. We may re-evaluate representing as bf:Work subclasses at a later date.

column4: Content cafe aggergated reviews of the resource
A topical, name, geographic, temporal, title, or genre subject of the resource.
column10: Most authorized terms and local terms are dereferenced (if necessary) and given an NYPL URI under the http://data.nypl.org/terms/ namespace.
column11: Genre terms currently folded into Subject. Need to consider how to represent locally-controlled list of categories vs. broad, uncontrolled range of current genre terms vs. application profiles based on genre type

Summary of the resource from content cafe
Online content supplementary to the resource
Temporary property to tell if the resource has a suppressed catalog record.
Temporal characteristics of the resource.
The primary title of the resource
Local field for display version of the title that includes the statement of responsibility (creator information)

? (This is an array of volume id and volume name pairs)

Definition
Identifies other copies of the same expression in the Registry (ex., items with the same catalog bnumber or photographic prints of the same photo).
A physical item holding the content of the resource.
Membership relationship with a child resource.
Physical reproduction of another core resource, ex. a microfilm reproduction of an archival collection. Does not apply to digital surrogates.
Resource that is contains the intellectual description of the the described physical item.
Membership relationship with a parent resource.
Has a physical reproduction, ex. a microfilm reproduction of an archival collection. Does not apply to digital surrogates.
